meanings.definition: A person who enjoys reading books.
meanings.sent1: My friend is a real bookworms and always has a book in hand.
meanings.sent2: Libraries are full of bookworms who love to explore different genres.
meanings.sent3: The bookworms in our book club never run out of books to discuss.
meanings.sent4: Her love for reading is so strong, she's practically a bookworms devouring every book in sight.
meanings.sent5: Being a bookworms means diving into different worlds with every turn of a page.

meanings.definition: Small insects that feed on the paper and glue in books.
meanings.sent1: The librarian found bookworms eating away at the old manuscripts.
meanings.sent2: Bookstores have to be careful to prevent bookworms from damaging their inventory.
meanings.sent3: The bookworms were having a feast on the library's rare collection.
meanings.sent4: The bookworms seemed to have a preference for classic novels over modern ones.
meanings.sent5: The bookworms left a trail of destruction in their path through the library.
